Identity.History: In winter, the arctic fox’s white coat is one of the warmest fur of any animal on the planet. Come summer their coats change to a gray-brown color. Arctic fox’s length range from 20-30 inches not counting their tail. That gives them an extra 10-17 inches. Arctic foxes dig complex burrow systems for shelter and child-rearing, and they are shared by many mating pairs over many generations.
